item.title: How To Get Wabbajack in Oblivion Remastered (Sheogorath Shrine Quest)
item.description:
Players can complete Sheogorath's Daedric Quest in Oblivion Remastered to obtain the Wabbajack, a hilarious artifact that's going to make enemies of the player turn into random creatures. The Wabbajack might not be the most powerful weapon in Oblivion Remastered , but it's a funny weapon with an even funnier quest, so players will want to know how to accomplish both.

The Wabbajack can be obtained in Oblivion Remastered without having even started the Shivering Isles DLC, as it's a base game artifact that's well worth the chaos that Sheogorath unfolds, so without further ado, here's how to get it.

Where to Find the Sheogorath Shrine in Oblivion Remastered

To start the quest for Wabbajack, players must be at least Level 2. Now, head to Sheogorath's Shrine, which can be found on the north-west side of Leyawiin by following the road to Bravil. At Sheogorath's Shrine, players can interact with Ferul Ravel, a follower of Sheogorath who will direct players to seek out three specific items in order to conduct a ritual and speak with Sheogorath, and the ritual items are as follows:

  • Head of Lettuce
  • Lesser Soul Gem
  • Yarn

Where to Find Lettuce, Lesser Soul Gem, and Yarn in Oblivion Remastered

These three random items can easily be found by going to the Imperial City's Market District. Each of the items will have a set location, and it's easier to grab them all here:

Item

Location

Lettuce

Purchased from Delos Fandas at The Feed Bag, Market District

Lesser Soul Gem

Purchased from Calindil at Mystic Emporium, Market District

Yarn

Found within crates and barrels in the open area of the Market District

With the three ritual items acquired, players can head back to the Shrine of Sheogorath, where they can now interact with it and leave their offerings at the altar. Upon doing this, Sheogorath will speak to the player and task them with stirring up trouble in the nearby settlement of Border Watch. Border Watch can be found just south of the Sheogorath Shrine on the road back to Leyawiin on the west side.

How to Start the First Prophecy in Oblivion Remastered

How to Get the Orloy Cheese

To begin Sheogorath's request, players will need to seek out Ri'Bassa. This NPC is a khajiit with black robes, and upon speaking to him, they can ask about the K'Sharra Prophecy. From here, it's important to say " I am a traveling scholar. " to get on Ri'Bassa's good side, as players will need 60 Disposition. At this point, ask about the "Three Signs", which will begin the necessary steps to making the prophecy come true.

For the first prophecy, players will need to start a rat plague. This can be easily achieved by heading to the Border Watch Inn. Once inside, look to the display case on the right, which contains the Olroy Cheese. This is behind a locked display case, so players have three ways of obtaining it:

  • Lockpick the display case from behind the wooden pillar so that the innkeeper does not see.
  • Pickpocket the innkeeper for the key and take the cheese when she is sleeping late at night.
  • Kill the innkeeper for the key and the Olroy Cheese without being detected.

With the Orloy Cheese acquired, players can return to the center, where there is a cooking pot where the cheese can be placed inside. Once inside, wait around for a bit, where oversized rats will begin to arrive. This will cause Ri'Bassa to place Rat Poison around the area, so follow him and pick up the Rat Poison as he places it down. He will only place two Rat Poisons.

How to Start the Second Prophecy in Oblivion Remastered

The second prophecy involves poisoning sheep, and so long as players have started the first prophecy, this will be extremely easy. After starting the first prophecy, Ri'Bassa will drop Rat Poison on the ground that players can pick up. With this Rat Poison now in the player's inventory, head past the Border Watch Inn and find the sheep's pen, where the feeding trough sits in the center. Players can interact with the feeding trough to place the Rat Poison inside, which will cause the sheep to wander towards the feeding trough and eventually die after eating from it.

How to Start the Third Prophecy in Oblivion Remastered

With the rat plague and the sheep poisoned, it's time to start the third and final prophecy. All players need to do for this third prophecy is head to the center of Border Watch and look up to the sky. Upon looking up at the sky, they will be locked into a cutscene where the sky begins to darken to an orange hue, and burning dogs will begin to fall from the sky. After it's literally rained dogs on the settlement of Border Watch, players can head back to Sheogorath's Shrine with a job well done.

How to Get the Wabbajack in Oblivion Remastered

Upon returning to Sheogorath's Shrine, Sheogorath himself will celebrate the madness caused by the player, and will then reward them with the Daedra Artifact, the Wabbajack. The Wabbajack is now the player's for as long as they decide not to sell it or get rid of it.

The Wabbajack is a powerful and hilarious Daedric Artifact, as it will transform non-NPC entities into random creatures for 10 seconds . It's a random staff that can be a lot of fun, but it's not really good for damaging foes, as it's more of an item for absurdity.

item.title: Fortnite's Arcane Skins May Have Run Their Course, but League of Legends May Yet Return
item.description:
Since the game's launch back in 2017, Fortnite has become the king of crossovers. When it comes to marketing, games, movies, TV shows, and even major brands have made Fortnite crossovers a major part of promotional efforts. There has been a cornucopia of great collaborations and partnerships featured in the game, and one of those popular crossovers was with Arcane . Unfortunately, these specific skins may not be returning any time soon.

Based on League of Legends , Arcane brought Netflix a unique and beloved video game adaptation. Protagonists Jinx and Vi lead the series, and their addition to Fortnite back in 2021 was exciting for a lot of gamers. Many have wanted the two characters to return, but recent statements from Riot Games co-founder Marc Merrill have left fans disappointed, as he made it sound as though Jinx and Vi wouldn't return to the battle royale; at least not any time soon. There is still a silver lining, though, that could pave the way for another League of Legends crossover with Fortnite .

There Are More League of Legends Shows Currently in Development

Arcane Was Just the Beginning

Last year, Arcane showrunner Christian Linke revealed in a Twitch interview that the next planned League of Legends show has already been in development for close to a year. Arcane only lasted two seasons, but fans of the series still have plenty to look forward to. Even better, though, is that this means Fortnite could have plenty of League of Legends crossover opportunities on the way.

Which League of Legends Regions Are Getting Their Own Shows?

  • Noxus
  • Demacia
  • Ionia

This trio of lands in the League of Legends universe opens the door to a deep well for Fortnite to draw from once these shows are finally complete. Right now, it's unclear who the protagonists of any future TV series will be, but another partnership between Fortnite and Riot Games isn't too far outside the realm of possibility. Fortnite is no stranger to repeat crossovers, so hopefully Riot Games will embrace the battle royale game once more when the time comes to promote the next show.

League of Legends ' most recent in-game season, Welcome to Noxus, began back in January. The empire of Noxus is defined by its reputation as a brutal and strength-obsessed society.

When addressing the one-off nature of the Jinx and Vi skins, Marc Merrill stated, "They’ve been great partners, but we haven’t been able to find the right fit to bring the Arcane skins back, and it unfortunately won’t be happening in the foreseeable future." Considering that the final season of Arcane premiered late last year, that would've seemed like the perfect time to bring the skins back, which makes Merrill's statement a bit surprising.

Last year, Arcane was nominated for Best Adaptation at the 2024 Game Awards. The award ultimately went to the Fallout series. Both shows star actor Ella Purnell.

Arcane's Follow-Up Shows Remain a Mystery

One of the biggest questions in the League of Legends community right now is when the first post- Arcane show will show itself. Arcane was incredibly well-received by both critics and viewers, and it makes the prospect of more spin-offs that much more exciting. The promise of getting a deep dive into Noxus, Demacia, and Ionia is thrilling, but this may prove to be a test of patience. It's a bummer that Jinx and Vi are unlikely to come back to Fortnite any time soon, but on the bright side, fresh skins could very well become a reality down the road.

item.title: Lost Skies Dev Explains Connection To World's Adrift
item.description:
One of the leading developers for Lost Skies has shed light on the new game’s connection to Worlds Adrift and what lessons the team at Bossa Games learned from its last major project. Lost Skies is a survival and exploration title set in a world populated by floating islands that players can explore for resources to build up their growing skyships. A demo of the game was released as part of Steam Next Fest back in February, and before that, players could download the free-to-play Island Creator and make their own tropical environments to explore.

Lost Skies shares many elements with Worlds Adrift , the MMO released by Bossa Games back in 2017. It also allowed players to navigate floating islands and build custom airships to battle PvP opponents. While Worlds Adrift earned rave reviews and was nominated for the "Creativity" and "Heritage" awards at The Independent Game Developers' Association Awards in 2018, it would ultimately be discontinued about a year later.

Game Rant recently spoke with Luke Williams, Lead Designer at Bossa Games, to discuss Lost Skies ahead of its Early Access Steam launch on April 18. One of the topics mentioned in this interview was how Lost Skies was connected to Worlds Adrift in terms of gameplay and overall themes. Williams answered that wonder and exploration were always at the heart of both games, especially in how players could build their own skyships and explore the open world either by themselves or with friends, saying, "We knew the core exploration mechanic was compelling, and a major pillar of Lost Skies was expanding on that."

Lost Skies and World’s Adrift Share A Narrative and Sense of Exploration

Williams also explained that narratively, Lost Skies and Worlds Adrift are set in the same universe, though Lost Skies takes place after a great catastrophe ended the world of Worlds Adrift . Players will piece together the mystery of what happened by exploring the floating islands of Lost Skies , an approach that Williams attributed to the game’s co-op PvE format. In contrast, Worlds Adrift was more focused on PvP battles, so the lore could only be discovered through note fragments. Williams elaborates on the narrative connection:

"Narratively, the games take place in the same universe, though we split the timeline at around the point where the catastrophe ends the world. Since Lost Skies is a more focused co-op PvE experience, we were able to lean much more into the story and allow players to unravel the mystery of what happened to the world, Worlds Adrift 's story could only be pieced together with fragments of notes.

Lost Skies is still heavily physics-driven and features a grappling hook and other familiar yet refined mechanics from Worlds Adrift ."

Now that Lost Skies is available on PC through Steam Early Access, Bossa Studios will be focused on gathering player feedback and making updates, as well as adding new content like ship parts and more islands to explore. It is the developer’s hope that Lost Skies can carry on in Worlds Adrift ’s place by providing a strong sense of freedom and discovery while allowing players to create their own worlds to navigate and share with friends online.

item.title: Oblivion Remastered: How Long to Beat
item.description:
All fans of the good old 2006 Oblivion should put everything aside because Oblivion Remastered has arrived. Bethesda has released one of its best games in a new, more modern shell. And this applies not only to the graphics but also to the gameplay. Therefore, in this guide, we will tell you how long to beat Oblivion Remastered .

Of course, Oblivion is an open world filled with various quests and characters. And as in the entire Scrolls series, your playthrough time will depend purely on your gaming style and how much you like to complete each possible quest.

Main Story Completion

Even though Oblivion Remastered is an improved version of the original game, this has hardly affected the main quest line. On average, players will need about 20-25 hours to complete the story , depending on the chosen difficulty level, as well as familiarity with the lands of Cyrodiil. An equally important factor is whether you are playing for the first time or you have completed Oblivion dozens of times and know the name of each NPC.

Main Quests With Side Content

You can truly get into the world of Oblivion only by completing dozens of side quests scattered throughout the world. Whether it is Dark Brotherhood, Mages Guild, Thieves Guild missions, or simple local quests in cities, they are all definitely worth your attention. Many sides are quite short, but some will take several hours of your life.

Thus, you will need 70-80 hours to beat Oblivion Remastered's main and side quests. But this is exactly the experience that every player should get when they first get acquainted with this game.

It is worth noting that Oblivion Remastered includes such expansions as Knights of the Nine and Shivering Isles . Their quests are no less exciting and will captivate you for another ten hours. This is especially true if you are exploring the world of Oblivion for the first time.

100% Completion

The most persistent players will probably want to beat Oblivion Remastered by 100%. To do this, they will have to complete all the quests, find all the unique items, explore every cave, and, of course, max out all their skills. If you are one of them, then you should expect to spend up to 150 hours in the game . However, in the case of leisurely exploration of the world, the time can stretch to 200 hours.
